title: Profile page onboarding navigation + consistent styling/back navigation across Feed, Tasks, and Geography

requirements.text: Update the Home page “Get Started” call-to-action so it directs the user into the “becoming a user” flow by taking them to the Profile page and prompting authentication if needed (instead of only opening the Secretary widget). Apply this behavior to the CTA in the “Get Started” section (App.tsx section id="get-started") and ensure the interaction is base-path-safe (uses joinBasePath and triggers popstate updates).

quotes: Lets tackle the profile page and make sure the "Get Started" button directs towards becoming a user

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the “Get Started” CTA navigates to /profile (base-path-safe) and the Profile page renders

If the user is not authenticated, the flow prompts the user to log in (Internet Identity) and then lands them on /profile (or remains on /profile showing the authentication-required state until login completes)
The CTA no longer only scrolls or only opens the Secretary widget as the primary action for becoming a user

requirements.text: Add consistent backward navigation controls to the Feed, Tasks, and Geography pages using the same UI pattern (labeling, placement, and behavior). The back action must reliably navigate to the appropriate previous logical destination and be base-path-safe (pushState + PopStateEvent, or history.back when appropriate) with consistent styling.

quotes: ...and that the Feed, Tasks, Geography pages are all similarly styled with consistent backwards navigation

acceptanceCriteria: Feed page includes a clear Back control that returns to Home (/) using base-path-safe navigation
Geography page includes a clear Back control that returns to Home (/) using base-path-safe navigation
Tasks list already has Back to Home; keep behavior but ensure its styling matches the chosen shared Back pattern
Task detail and task create already have Back to List; keep behavior but ensure their Back control styling matches the chosen shared Back pattern

requirements.text: Normalize page layout styling across Feed, Tasks, and Geography so they feel like the same application section (consistent header approach, spacing, and card styling). In particular, remove the bespoke fixed black header styling on GeographyPage and align it with the layout used on other pages (e.g., HomeHeader + consistent main container spacing).

quotes: ...Feed, Tasks, Geography pages are all similarly styled...

acceptanceCriteria: Geography page no longer uses a one-off fixed black header; it visually matches the general page layout used by Feed/Tasks
Feed, Tasks list, Task detail, Task create, and Geography pages share consistent top padding/offset so content does not clash with the header
Typography (page title/subtitle), container widths, and primary Card styling are consistent across these pages

requirements.text: On the Profile page, add a clear, consistent Back navigation control (matching the Feed/Tasks/Geography back pattern) so users can easily return to the Home page after onboarding/profile edits.
acceptanceCriteria: Profile page displays a Back control near the top of the main content area
Back control navigates to Home (/) using base-path-safe SPA navigation
Back control styling is consistent with the Back controls on Feed/Tasks/Geography

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components are read-only and must be composed)
Do not edit immutable frontend hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead)
Keep routing compatible with the existing pushState/popstate approach in frontend/src/App.tsx (no Next.js / React Router additions)
nonGoals: Do not redesign or change Secretary widget flows or intent/navigation registry beyond what is required for the updated Get Started CTA
Do not add new backend data models or change Motoko stable state for this request
Do not implement new Feed/Tasks/Geography features beyond styling and navigation consistency
